commands.name: jira-advance-to-next-status
commands.title: Jira: Advance to Next Status
commands.description: Advance a Jira ticket to its next workflow status

commands.name: jira-move-to-done
commands.title: Jira: Move to Done
commands.description: Move a Jira ticket through all remaining statuses to Done

commands.name: jira-workflow-status-board
commands.title: Jira: Workflow Status Board
commands.description: View all your in-progress Jira issues grouped by workflow status

preferences.name: jiraCliPath
preferences.title: Jira CLI Path
preferences.description: Full path to the jira binary. Leave blank to use PATH.

preferences.name: jiraProject
preferences.title: Default Project Key
preferences.description: Used when entering bare ticket numbers like '123'.

preferences.name: jiraServer
preferences.title: Jira Server URL
preferences.description: Your Jira instance base URL (e.g. https://yourcompany.atlassian.net).

preferences.name: jiraApiToken
preferences.title: Jira API Token
preferences.description: Bearer token for Jira authentication (same as JIRA_API_TOKEN env var).

preferences.name: commonAssignees
preferences.title: Common Assignees
preferences.description: Comma-separated list of common assignee emails for quick assignment.

preferences.name: qaAssignee
preferences.title: QA Assignee
preferences.description: Auto-assign to this person when moving to Testing status.

preferences.name: reviewerAssignee
preferences.title: Reviewer Assignee
preferences.description: Auto-assign to this person when moving to 1ST REVIEW or 2ND REVIEW status.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
